intro: Acosta triniifolia, commonly known as the Three-leafed Acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Acosta triniifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun.
